title: How Starcloud Is Bringing Data Centers to Outer Space
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-10-16, Reading time: 4 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fblogs.nvidia.com%2Fblog%2Fstarcloud%2F%3Futm_source=tldrai/1/01000199ed2c3321-3308ac3f-e0ac-421a-8313-e265ad8cddc2-000000/AEikd1m_Qcjr7VleKkhDolebN7bf0qogdlg6iMJqbVU=427
summary: How Starcloud Is Bringing Data Centers to Outer Space (4 minute read) Starcloud, under NVIDIA Inception, plans to launch AI-equipped satellites to establish data centers in space, aiming for 10x lower energy costs and higher sustainability. Its 5-gigawatt orbital center will leverage solar energy and space's vacuum for cooling, conserving Earth's resources. This approach offers faster processing for applications like wildfire detection and Earth observation, utilizing NVIDIA's advanced GPUs f...

title: Meta and Arm Team Up on AI Infrastructure
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-10-16, Reading time: 4 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Ftechcrunch.com%2F2025%2F10%2F15%2Farm-partners-with-meta-to-scale-ai-efforts%2F%3Futm_source=tldrai/1/01000199ed2c3321-3308ac3f-e0ac-421a-8313-e265ad8cddc2-000000/_Kd6uzHfSRAfHb5wQizAAMf5JHZZ77DJgD0aZjAzUC4=427
summary: Meta and Arm Team Up on AI Infrastructure (4 minute read) Meta is migrating its AI ranking and recommendation systems to Arm's Neoverse platform as part of a multi-year partnership aimed at scaling AI infrastructure. The deal focuses on energy-efficient cloud AI deployments, without involving ownership stakes or shared physical assets.

summary: Navan pushes ahead with IPO during government shutdown (4 minute read) Navan, formerly TripActions, is moving forward with its IPO despite the US government shutdown, using a new SEC rule that lets filings automatically go effective after 20 days without staff review. The company plans to sell 30 million shares (plus 7 million from insiders) at $24–$26 each, targeting a $6.45 billion valuation and raising up to $960 million. title: Stripe introduces stablecoin payments for subscriptions
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-10-16, Reading time: 2 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.finextra.com%2Fpressarticle%2F107531%2Fstripe-introduces-stablecoin-payments-for-subscriptions%3Futm_source=tldrfintech/1/01000199ed2f3959-cb32d4ab-c3ca-4ebf-8f7e-129466a5c420-000000/wjjIchrpILXqCeyItcIv_u3HRaF7ZnAVvMKZYvZ01ds=427
summary: Stripe introduces stablecoin payments for subscriptions (2 minute read) Since launching stablecoin payments a year ago, we've seen stablecoins enable the rapid global expansion of some of the fastest-growing companies today. Stripe is rolling out stablecoin-based subscriptions in private preview to US-based businesses, and supporting subscription payments made in USDC over the Base and Polygon blockchains.

title: Building Sustainable Bank-Fintech Partnerships

summary: Building Sustainable Bank-Fintech Partnerships (15 minute read) Banks and fintechs must bridge fundamentally different business models - deterministic software logic versus probabilistic risk-based financial systems - to collaborate effectively. True sustainability requires clear alignment on governance, risk controls, data sharing, and accountability from day one.
